content.raw:
No, but other tasks "run" a GMTK task (and therefore use the verb "run")--this one just passes the train prog as a dummy (due to segway-task requirements) and never uses it. Only purpose is to create the validation set observations.

Changed to a constant now, along with the other validation verbs

content.raw: This function has two large code paths on a single conditional and doing two separate things. It should almost certainly be separated into two different functions. One for creating a random held out set, one for creating a heldout set based on coords given.

content.html: Fixed

content.raw: This constant is a bit of a misnomer. You don't really care what the "default" value is in this case. You care about whether or not a value was specified (hence None as your "default") and that the validation fraction exists - not what the setting value contains. I'd remove it entirely. Argparse actually puts "None" as the default for all it's options anyway. If it is not specified you can simply check it's existence by checking if the option itself evaluates to true e.g. `if self.validation_fraction`
content.html: This constant is a bit of a misnomer. You don't really care what the "default" value is in this case. You care about whether or not a value was specified (hence None as your "default") and that the validation fraction exists - not what the setting value contains. I'd remove it entirely. Argparse actually puts "None" as the default for all it's options anyway. If it is not specified you can simply check it's existence by checking if the option itself evaluates to true e.g. if self.validation_fraction

content.raw:
The overall problem with this function is it seems to be wearing many hats at once and it sort of hidden in a "load" verb which is a little misleading. It has 4 different outputs (including the returned value). The logic *looks* like it can be separated out.  Perhaps a parsing function that returns the a tuple of validation window indices and likelihoods. Another function that logs the full validation output. Another function that calculates the liklihood from the the index and liklihood list.

Perhaps something closer to along those lines?
content.html:
The overall problem with this function is it seems to be wearing many hats at once and it sort of hidden in a "load" verb which is a little misleading. It has 4 different outputs (including the returned value). The logic looks like it can be separated out. Perhaps a parsing function that returns the a tuple of validation window indices and likelihoods. Another function that logs the full validation output. Another function that calculates the liklihood from the the index and liklihood list.

Perhaps something closer to along those lines?
